Class RequestToBeAReviewerTest

java.lang.Object
tests.RequestToBeAReviewerTest
public class RequestToBeAReviewerTest extends Object
This class the testing of the Question and Answers functionalities using a database connection
Author:
Darren Fernandes

  • Constructor Details

    • RequestToBeAReviewerTest

      public RequestToBeAReviewerTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUpDatabase

      public void setUpDatabase()
      This class sets up the database and ensures that each time the test is called, the database is set back up from scratch. This ensures that each test is run without any issues and that there is nothing interfering with the test, as well as ensures that each test is run on the unedited version of the database and its contents. It also registers a user and a request from scratch

    • testCreatingRequest

      public void testCreatingRequest()
      This is the first test for the request class. It just checks if there exists a request equal to the one that was registered in the before class. It is successful if they are both equal, and also catches exceptions, here the database and nullpointer exceptions are possible

    • testSeeingRequest

      public void testSeeingRequest()
      This test checks who all have permission to see a review. At this point, without any manipulation only the instructor should be able to see the request, meaning that getting all the requests should show us that the instructor's variable requestTOF should be true and the Admin's variable requestATOF should be false

    • InstructorAccept

      public void InstructorAccept()
      This test checks the permissions again but if they were updated to be visible to only the admin. In this case only the admin's visibility should be true, and the the instructor's is false

    • InstructorDecline

      public void InstructorDecline()
      When the instructor declines a request, it should not longer appear on the instructor's side

    • DeleteRequestTest

      public void DeleteRequestTest()
      This is what does happen when the request is accepted, which is it is deleted from the database. If this is true, then there should be nothing in the database, meaning when we try and get the requests, the table should be empty.
